content:
TITLE: Managing PostHog Sourcemaps
DESCRIPTION: Complete workflow for building, injecting snippets, uploading sourcemaps, and running the application with sourcemap support. Includes environment variable configuration for both standard and NextJS builds.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/error-tracking/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Generate build artifacts and use posthog-cli to inject snippets into sources and sourcemaps
VITE_POSTHOG_KEY='<your-project-key>' VITE_POSTHOG_HOST='http://localhost:8010' pnpm run build

# For NextJS based app use
NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_KEY='<your-project-key>' NEXT_PUBLIC_HOST='http://localhost:8010' pnpm run build

# Use posthog-cli to inject snippets into sources and sourcemaps
pnpm run inject

# Upload sourcemaps to PostHog
pnpm run upload

# Run application locally with newly generated minified build and sourcemaps
# Start sending exceptions to PostHog
pnpm run preview
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Demonstrating Type-Checking Functions in PostHog JS
DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases examples of custom type-checking functions used in PostHog JS to reduce bundle size. Functions like 'isNull' and 'isBoolean' are mentioned as alternatives to standard JavaScript type checks.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/eslint-rules/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Markdown
CODE:
```
For example, we have a number of functions that check types like `isNull` or `isBoolean`.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: PostHog JS Changelog Entries
DESCRIPTION: Markdown formatted changelog entries documenting version history and changes to the PostHog JavaScript SDK. Each entry includes version number, date, and bullet points describing changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## 1.105.4 - 2024-02-07

- feat: Add dynamic routing of ingestion endpoints (#986)
- Update CHANGELOG.md (#1004)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Changelog Entries
DESCRIPTION: Changelog entries documenting version updates, bug fixes, features and other changes to the PostHog JavaScript library. Each entry includes version number, date and list of changes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
## 1.45.0 - 2023-02-14

## 1.43.1 - 2023-02-07

- fix: correctly persist user state across page loads (#531)

## 1.43.0 - 2023-02-07

- feat: reset marks user anonymous (#524)

...
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building PostHog.js React Components
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the PostHog.js React Components project using pnpm. It runs the predefined build script configured in the project's package.json file, which likely compiles and bundles the React components for production use.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/react/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Unit Tests for PostHog.js React Components
DESCRIPTION: This command executes the unit tests for the PostHog.js React Components project using pnpm. It runs the predefined test script configured in the project's package.json file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/react/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running PostHog with Local Instance
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the development server against a locally running PostHog instance with custom host configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/nextjs/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_KEY='<your-local-api-key>' NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_HOST='http://localhost:8010' pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting PostHog Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server with a PostHog API key configuration.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/nextjs/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_KEY='<your-local-api-key>' pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up PostHog JS Project Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing project dependencies and building a local version of posthog-js using pnpm package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/error-tracking/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Install deps
pnpm install

# Build local version of posthog-js
pnpm run build-posthog
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Next.js Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start Next.js development server with PostHog configuration
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_KEY='<your-local-api-key>' NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_HOST='http://localhost:8000' pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Nuxt Development Server with PostHog Integration
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Nuxt development server after configuration. This allows you to view the PostHog Nuxt demo project in your browser at the specified localhost address.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/nuxtjs/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Local PostHog JS Changes
DESCRIPTION: Command to test local changes with environment variables for PostHog key and host.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/nextjs/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_KEY='<your-local-api-key>' NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_HOST='http://localhost:8000' pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Vite Development Server for PostHog Surveys
DESCRIPTION: Launch the Vite development server to run and test PostHog surveys in a local environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/vite-surveys/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm run dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Publishing NPM Prerelease Version
DESCRIPTION: Commands for publishing alpha/beta versions to NPM
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm version [premajor | preminor | prepatch] --preid=beta
npm publish --tag beta
git push --tags
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Cross-domain Development Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the development server with cross-domain support and self-signed certificate generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/nextjs/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_KEY='<your-local-api-key>' NEXT_PUBLIC_POSTHOG_HOST='http://localhost:8000' pnpm dev-crossdomain
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running TestCafe with BrowserStack Credentials
DESCRIPTION: Commands for exporting BrowserStack credentials and running TestCafe E2E tests
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
export BROWSERSTACK_USERNAME=xxx BROWSERSTACK_ACCESS_KEY=xxx
npx testcafe "browserstack:ie" testcafe/e2e.spec.js
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PostHog CLI Requirements
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for installing the PostHog CLI tool globally using Cargo package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/error-tracking/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
# Install PostHog CLI globally
cargo install posthog-cli
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with PNPM for PostHog Surveys
DESCRIPTION: Install the required dependencies for the PostHog surveys project using PNPM package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/vite-surveys/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Dependencies with PNPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install PNPM package manager globally at version 9
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install -g pnpm@latest-9
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Host File Configuration for Cross-domain Testing
DESCRIPTION: DNS configurations for testing cross-domain behavior by pointing subdomains to localhost.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/nextjs/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
127.0.0.1 www.posthog.dev
127.0.0.1 app.posthog.dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to Vite Surveys Directory in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Change the current working directory to the Vite surveys playground folder.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/vite-surveys/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd playground/vite-surveys
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Restarting MacOS DNS Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to restart the DNS server on MacOS after host file modifications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/PostHog/posthog-js/blob/main/playground/nextjs/README.md#2025-04-06_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo killall -HUP mDNSResponder
```
